page.title: 05WRAWBY STREET (CONTD.)
page.content: have their premises in this hundred yard long street and the Trustees Savings Bank is the sole bank. At the eastern end of the street the cinema has been replaced by a group dwelling for the elderly and the former police station now houses the magistrates clerk's offices, the courtroom remaining in its original site. A residential home for elderly people in need of care is situated at the very end of the street where the workhouse once existed. There are a few empty properties including a disused congregational chapel but two saddlers, an art shop and craft shops help to retain Brigg's links with the past as a market town.
